nodes.bodyText: Why we define this policyList  variable outside the promise lambda function? I think it's better to move it inside the lambda function scope and refer it
Same as above , no need to declare the variable outside the lambda function scope right ? incrementId

Why we use Object constructor here ?
This will convert null or undefined values to objects ?
The Object constructor creates an object wrapper for the given value.

If the value is null or undefined, it will create and return an empty object.
Otherwise, it will return an object of a Type that corresponds to the given value.
If the value is an object already, it will return the value.
This helps us identify which conditional values need to be converted to an array.
This is no-op , What is the purpose of these 2 lines? Object.keys

There will be multiple condition values when it comes to IP range and IP. To display these multiple values in the MUI data table we need to create a key, value array since we can't parse an object to the MUI data table.

Ok but these
Object.values(obj.conditionValue)
Object.keys(obj.conditionValue)
two lines doesn't make any effect unless you use their returned values , It's like console.log(obj.conditionValue) statments

Only Object.entries(obj.conditionValue); does the task.
Fixed with commit
Do we need to create a new Promise here?, Is this because of that Alert message issue ?

Nope not for the alert.
We need to send a new promise for it to get resolved in the ListBase
It's not good to add additional async operations unless it's absolutely needed, I don't see any requirement to create a promise object here ?
If you only return the res.conditionStatus what is the purpose of setting other res properties in above if condition ?
editedConditionId and editedConditionStatus are needed to identify the conditionID and Condition Status of the edited Policy. These two values are passed to the API call.

I think, If you want to change the elements in the blacklistPolicyListNew  using the event data, It's better to return modified element in the map and use the return value from the map and set it to state, by that way you might not need to cloneDeep it beforehand
If i do it as mentioned above then all the Switch items flickers when I change one, but if I clone deep this doesnt happen
